byline.contributor: Michael Cieply contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

abstract: Race moves front and center in discussions of 2016 Oscar ballot, where all 20 actor nominees are white for second consecutive year, and all films with black themes have been shut out entirely; Cheryl Boone Isaacs, first black president of Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, labels all-white nominations are unfortunate, but says she does not see trend in back-to-back shutout, noting that good work is perennially snubbed by Oscars.

headline.print_headline: Another Oscar Year, Another All-White Ballot
headline.main: Another Oscar Year, Another All-White Ballot

keywords.value: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A second year with no minority actors singled out for Academy Awards leads to finger-pointing.
lead_paragraph: A second year with no minority actors singled out for Academy Awards leads to finger-pointing.
